messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/10/2000 1:49:49 PM Central Daylight Time, ... books ... How do you ever keep track?  It seems like every time we get lots of books, we end
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/10/2000 1:49:49 PM Central Daylight Time,
bctswim@... writes:

> every time i go to the library i hear--are you aware that there are 99+
books
>
> out on your account?! rofl!
> bridget


How do you ever keep track? It seems like every time we get lots of books,
we end up making a significant "donation" to the library book fund when we
can't find a couple of them. Invariably something gets mixed up in our own
stash at home and we don't find it for months! By then it's too late to make
good at the library.

Carron

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sick commercials ...

every time i go to the library i hear--are you aware that there are 99+ books

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/6/00 9:46:26 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
thediva@... writes:

<< We still got the bookbags cause we needed them to carry home all the
library
books!!. (91 and growing--on MY account--more on the kids!) >>
WOW! I thought we were book wealthy with 20!

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: Cathie said: Its more fun now cause I don t have to waste my money on the *cool* ... Shirley says: We still got the bookbags cause we needed them to carry home
messages.messageBody:
Cathie said:

Its more fun now cause I don't have to waste my money on the *cool*
> notebooks or bookbags.
>
Shirley says:

We still got the bookbags cause we needed them to carry home all the library
books!!. (91 and growing--on MY account--more on the kids!)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sick commercials ...
messages.msgSnippet: We love buying school supplies! Seems I can t go near Barnes and Noble without dropping a bundle of money. Or a World of Science store! Even the regular
messages.messageBody:
We love buying school supplies! Seems I can't go near Barnes and Noble
without dropping a bundle of money. Or a World of Science store! Even the
regular stuff-nothing like getting crayons and markers and all on sale at
Walmart. I came home with over 3000 sheets of paper which is one of those
extremely secure feelings to me-like having your cupboards stocked with
food. Its more fun now cause I don't have to waste my money on the *cool*
notebooks or bookbags.

Cathie

P.S. I love your little ones ideas!!


>Well, they should take pictures of the kidlets when we "un" school shop.
>All the other kids are out school shopping, so we do lists of project and
>go and buy kits and plans and fun stuff to do. We just bought one of those
>little sticker cameras and youngest kidlet is going to do cyclist licenses
>(she says that way she can give her brother a ticket for parking his
>bicycle where it doesn't belong) and passport for her dolls so they can
>travel the world.
>
>Of course, the pictures would be of happy kids who AREN'T going to school.
>
>Lynda
>
>----------

> > To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> > Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] sick commercials ...

> >

> > racing up/down the aisles throwing school supplies in the basket while
>the
> > kids stood @ the end of the aisle looking SO FORLORNED!!! I thought
>that
> > was *SAD* ... ohhhhh, I HOPE AND PRAY I *NEVER* snuff out my fellas
>desire
> > to *LEARN* ...
> >
> > Pris
